reviews.text: Rooms are very old , looks like they Never renew them in the past 40 years .The service is bad, most of the service providers are old as the hotel with bad atitude.
reviews.title: Very old with bad atiitude by the front desk and by the bellboys

reviews.text: I am sure there are better beach fronts hotels in tel aviv. And if not why not to stay in Jerusalem. We stayed there at the mamilla hotel whic was amazing.
reviews.title: Probably the worst 5* I've been to.

reviews.text: Rooms were fairly austere. Somewhere around 2* quality. The overall sense was that this place is just a tad too old and in need of a renovation.
reviews.title: Very fine indeed

reviews.text: The hotel lounge and only restaurant had exceptionally poor quality food. It made my stay quite miserable as this was a business trip and didn't want to spend too much time about town finding food when I had a lot of work to do.
reviews.title: Fantastic place, best hotel in TLV

reviews.text: Breakfast was OK, but most westerners might find the selection available odd, and obviously a lot of the food isn't fresh. I know some might say something along the lines of 'when in Rome". But I'm sorry this is the Hilton, and when I go out to far more exotic places than Israel, I still get my bacon and eggs.
reviews.title: BEST HILTON IN THE CHAIN!!

reviews.text: The hotel is at the end of hotel row (north) which did not bother us but may be inconvenient for some. Having said that, it is known for the best hotel pool in Tel Aviv and for its beach. All rooms have sea views. The 12th floor executive lounge staff are exceptional and went out of their way for us. Front desk staff are friendly as are the house keeping staff. We appreciate the gifts found in our rooms every day. This is a great example of combining an otherwise American chain with international flair.
reviews.title: The Welcome Mat

reviews.text: I have been staying here for as long as can remember. I have stayed at both the Intercontinental and the Sheraton and think this is the best in Tel Aviv. I always stay on the Vista floors and think the loung is really great. The staff is very friendly. The pool is the best in Tel Aviv and I used to think it was inconvenient but now that the port is open, it is great.
reviews.title: My Favorite in Tel Aviv

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I enjoyed this hotel the staff were very helpful. We were upgraded to a suite with our HH.
reviews.title: Good Hilton Hospitality

reviews.text: For our anniversary we were given a bottle of bubbly.
reviews.title: Great location and beach but cold and impersonal staff and hotel overall.

reviews.text: No complaints. Breakfast true Israeli style.,lots of variety and good diet section too. Swimming pool on roof has a few too many chairs making it a bit crowded but all in all excellent.
reviews.title: An ok time

reviews.text: We stayed on the Vista floor, which is on Level 16; we had a renovated room which was large, modern with a great King Size bed. The hotel is nice by Tel Aviv's standards but is not equivalent to other 5 star hotels around the world.
reviews.title: Not a 5 star hotel

reviews.text: The lift is ridiculously slow, the foyer is tired and it's frantically busy a little bit like a bus station.
reviews.title: Very good choice for Tel Aviv
Beautiful
reviews.text: We stayed in these superiors rooms where we are supposed to have breakfast on a separate floor, which is a very small version of the main buffet downstairs. We wanted a full breakfast downstairs, however were told that this would be an additional $5 per person, per day for eating downstairs. Wifi which does not work well is $15 per device per day. The gym is $15, per person, per day. I brought all these charges up with the hotel and they were able to remove the $5 breakfast charges but could not remove the WIFI or gym charges as they said that the gym and IT departments are a separate company.
When you are paying $500+ per night who wants to pay extra for gym, breakfast in the main foyer and WIFI, especially when the hotel is not even near a 5 star hotel that we would usually stay at.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.text: The location is excellent, the beach is great, but we will not return to this hotel. Next time we will rent an apartment or look at something better.
reviews.title: very hectic beachfront hotel

reviews.text: Be careful - items are stolen from guest rooms. Security will not follow up for days. The hotel will take no responsibility. Also, plan on 30 - 45 minutes to check out. Last, if you reserve your room with points, be prepared to show your email receipt. Then, be prepared to follow up with HIlton Honors, as this property often charges you instead of applying your points. This makes for a poor experience.
reviews.title: Rude employees, argumentative, not helpful at all

reviews.text: If you don't care about how you are treated, I would definitely recommend this beautiful hotel, which sits on a beautiful beach in a great location that can be admired from beautiful rooms. If you do care how you are treated, stay somewhere else!!! Our bad experience began at the pool when the pool supervisor, Avi, insulted us by relentlessly calling us liars about how many people were in our room (my husband, me, & 10 year old child). When he wasn't haggling us, he was kissing on the Natives & flirting with the female teen girls. Housekeeping was very rude and upset when we needed an extra towel for 3 people to take showers (apparently each room is only allotted 2 bath towels). We requested and paid extra for a late Shabbat checkout (8pm). At 5pm, the front desk manager, Roger, called asking if we 'have a problem' because checkout is at noon. When we attempted to explain we had a late checkout, he demanded to know who we talked to and when we made this request because he didn't have it in his system, again inferring we were liars. We went to the desk to speak with him & he denied the conversation and blamed a new computer system for the mistakes, which would have been understandable without having been insulted.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, but staff were unfriendly to this American family

reviews.text: I visiti Israel twice a year and always struggle with where to stay. I usually stay at THE MONTEFIORE boutique hotel. In my opinion it is the best hotel in Tel-Aviv if you are looking for something more sophisticated and on a smaller scale. The one drawback is that when you come to Tel-Aviv it is nice to be on the beach which Montefiore hotel is not.
reviews.title: Spectacular views, Excellent Service, Outdated Decor

reviews.text: This time I decided to try the Hilton, with it's excellent location and spectacular views of the sea.
reviews.title: Oldie but still a goodie

reviews.text: Here are the pros:
reviews.title: Outdated hotel
